channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: This hole + depression in the gate entrance, 7th April
item.description:
The hole is one that keeps opening up on the corner of Mill Lane next to field gates. It is important to be able to use all the road here together with the gate entrance especially going towards Ham Road and two vehicles want to pass each other on the narrow section. Please can the hole be repaired and the rough part adjacent to the road be smoothed out.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Mill Lane, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: May be small but are sharp edged, 7th April
item.description:
The location is just past the gate into Woodbine cottage. The holes are quite sharp to hit - hence how they were found! Please can they be filled in.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Aggs Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Potholes in the vehicle track on narrow section of Aggs Hill, 7th April
item.description:
The potholes have developed on the corner up from the entrance to Lower Laynes. They are difficult to miss either up or down the road. Please can they be filled in
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Aggs Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Potholes - now long standing, 7th April
item.description:
The location is about 20 yrds from the corner of Birdlip Road going up Aggs Hill. The potholes are now deaper and the road has been breaking up for some time. Please can these be repaired.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Aggs Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Cyclist pushbutton demand being constantly registered at Hare & Hound junction., 7th April
item.description:
Hare & Hound junction at the cyclist crossing beside the church. Problem has existed for at least one week. This crossing point lacks a kerbside detector so the traffic signal controller always runs the pedestrian stage on each cycle whether or not there are pedestrians/cyclists waiting.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 397-399, Innsworth Lane, Churchdown, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Unpermitted roadworks problem, 7th April
item.description:
Customer reports that STW have been at the location, reversed their vehicle onto the pavement and broken two flag stones. They are, also, not complying with H&S in respect of the Stihl disc cutter they are using: no water is being used and there is concrete dust everywhere, with cement residue on theirs and other's vehicles.
Report on FixMyStreet

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 6-8, Albion Walk, Ewens Farm, Cheltenham

item.title: Commercial bins & Delivery Scooter, 7th April
item.description:
These bins belong to Burger King on the High Street. They are continuously parked on double yellow lines in Church Lane and block the public right of way to the Minster Churchyard a Heritage Site. It’s about time they or their contractors are heavily fined.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Church Street, Ewens Farm, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Obstruction by unpermitted skip, scaffolding, building material on pavement

item.title: Moderate size branch broken and hanging above parking bay, 7th April
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 26, Kings Road, Ewens Farm, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Cracks all along the Reddings Road, 7th April
item.description:
The cracks along the Reddings Road are appalling and make the road un-cyclable. Every few meters, there are cracks int he carriageway that are getting worse. Whilst individually they are not significant potholes, the fact that there are so many of them, and they stretch across the whole road, makes it incredibly difficult to cycle down this road. Please fill these cracks as a matter of urgency.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 76, Reddings Road, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
